verses.roman:
tasya tat karma vijñāya
kṛṣṇaḥ śaraṇa-daḥ satām
gopān nayantaṁ jagrāha
vṛkaṁ harir ivaujasā

synonyms: tasya—of him, Vyomāsura; tat—that; karma—activity; vijñāya—fully understanding; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; śaraṇa—of shelter; daḥ—the giver; satām—to saintly devotees; gopān—cowherd boys; nayantam—who was leading; jagrāha—He seized; vṛkam—a wolf; hariḥ—a lion: iva-just as; ojasā—forcefully.
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa, who shelters all saintly devotees, understood perfectly well what Vyomāsura was doing. Just as a lion grabs a wolf, Kṛṣṇa forcefully seized the demon as he was taking away more cowherd boys.
